page.title: 17Coast - The Ghost
page.content: At one time, Macduff's Castle was supposed to have been haunted by the White Lady of the Court Cave. The White Lady is reputed to be the ghost of a West Fife laird who deserted her home and joined a band of gypsies, having fallen in love with one of them. Convicted on false evidence on a charge of stealing some fruit, she was sentenced to be whipped. She was so ashamed she died from a brocken heart. The gypsies, who at that time inhabited the Court Cave, quarrelled over her conviction. While they argued a female clad in white suddenly appeared. The ghost of the White Lady was said to haunt the gypsies until the real theif confessed and even after that she was supposed to have made occasional appearances in the grounds of the castle and the caves.
